term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - bond-dissociation energy (BDE) in theoretical chemistry
term.title: bond-dissociation energy

item.text: For a diatomic molecule, the maximum vibrational energy that a molecule can have prior to its decomposition into the ground electronic states of the constituent atoms (spectroscopic bond-dissociation energy, De). The De value is related to the chemical dissociation energy: D0 = De - Evib(0), where E vib 0 is zero-point vibrational energy. This definition is usually extended to the dissociation of polyatomic molecules into certain molecular fragments through homolytic or heterolytic bond cleavages.
